sen.j: 手水鉢（ちょうずばち）とは、元来、神前、仏前で口をすすぎ、身を清めるための水を確保するための器をさす。
sen.e: Chozubachi originally referred to the bowl to hold water for people to purify themselves by rinsing their mouths before the altar of shrine or temple.
Chozubachi originally referred to a bowl holding water for people to purify themselves by rinsing out their mouths before the altar of a shrine or temple.
Chozubachi originally referred to a bowl holding water for people to purify themselves by rinsing out their mouths before the altar of a shrine or a temple.

sen.j: その後茶の湯にも取り入れられ、露地の中に置かれるようになり、つくばいと呼ばれる独特の様式を形成していった。
sen.e: Later, it came to be used in the tea ceremony, being placed in roji (a garden adjacent to a ceremonial teahouse), and developed the distinctive style called tsukubai (a stone washbasin).
Later, it came to be used in the tea ceremony, being placed in roji (a garden adjacent to a ceremonial teahouse), and developed the distinctive style called tsukubai (a stone washbasin).
Later, it came to be used in the tea ceremony, being placed in roji (a garden adjacent to a ceremonial teahouse), and developed the distinctive style called tsukubai (a stone washbasin).

sen.j: 手水鉢の種類
sen.e: Varieties of chozubachi
Varieties of chozubachi
Varieties of chozubachi

sen.j: 自然石手水鉢
sen.e: Chozubachi made of natural stone
Chozubachi made of natural stone
Chozubachi made of natural stone

sen.j: 自然石のもつ野趣を重視して作られたものでわび・さびなどの茶道の精神を具現化しているとも言える。
sen.e: It can be said that this type of chozubachi embodies a spirit of the tea ceremony, wabi (taste for the simple and quiet) and sabi (subdued refinement), emphasizing rustic beauty of natural stone.
It is said that this type of chozubachi embodies the spirit of the tea ceremony, wabi (taste for the simple and quiet) and sabi (subdued refinement), emphasizing the rustic beauty of natural stone.

It is said that this type of chozubachi embodies the spirit of the tea ceremony, such as wabi (taste for the simple and quiet) and sabi (subdued refinement), emphasizing the rustic beauty of natural stone.

sen.j: 自然石の形状は千差万別なので、以下は一例である。
sen.e: As each natural stone has its own shape, the following are only some examples among many.
As each natural stone has its own shape, the following are only some examples among many.

sen.j: 富士型
sen.e: The Fuji type
The Fuji type
The Fuji type

sen.j: 山の形をした岩石の上部に円い穴をあけたものである。
sen.e: This chozubachi is made by creating a hole on the top of the mountain-shaped rock.
This chozubachi is made by creating a hole in the top of the mountain-shaped rock.
This chozubachi is made by creating a hole at the top of the mountain-shaped rock.

sen.j: 山の中の山である富士山にちなんでこの名前がある。
sen.e: It was named after Mt. Fuji, the highest mountain in Japan.
It was named after Mt. Fuji, the highest mountain in Japan.
It was named after Mt. Fuji, the most famous mountain in Japan.
sen.cmt: 原文の内容に合わせて修正

sen.j: 本歌は鹿苑寺（金閣寺 京都市）の夕佳亭の露地である。
sen.e: The original one is placed in roji of the Sekka-tei in the Rokuon-ji Temple (Kinkaku-ji Temple, Kyoto City).
The original one is placed in roji of the Sekka-tei in the Rokuon-ji Temple (Kinkaku-ji Temple, Kyoto City).

sen.j: 一文字型
sen.e: The straight line type
The straight line type
The straight line type

sen.j: 細長い自然石の上を平らにして、長い水を入れる穴を掘ったもの。
sen.e: This type of chozubachi is created by evening out the surface of the long natural stone and hollowing it to make a hole to hold water.
This type of chozubachi is created by plaining out the surface of a long natural stone and then hollowing it out to make a hole to hold water.
This type of chozubachi is created by plaining out the surface of a long natural stone and then hollowing it out to make a hole to hold water.

sen.j: 青蓮院書院縁先が有名。
sen.e: The good example is the one in front of the veranda of the drawing room in the Shoren-in Temple.
A good example is the one in front of the veranda of the drawing room of the Shoren-in Temple.

The sickle type
The sickle type

sen.j: 鎌のように曲がった自然石に円形か楕円の穴を掘ったもので桂離宮月破楼露地が有名。
sen.e: It is a chozubachi made of the sickle-shaped natural stone with a round or oval shape hole; the one in the roji of Gepparo (tea pavilion) of Katsura Imperial Villa is well known.
It is a chozubachi made of the sickle-shaped natural stone with a round or oval shaped hole; the one in the roji of Gepparo (tea pavilion) of Katsura Imperial Villa is well known.

sen.j: 船の形をした石に穴をあけたもので最もよく見られるものの一つ。
sen.e: This is one of the most typical chozubachi and created by making a hole in the boat-shaped stone.
This is one of the most typical chozubachi and created by making a hole in a boat-shaped stone.

sen.j: 誰が袖型

The tagasode (literally sleeve) type
The tagasode (literally sleeve) type

sen.j: 着物の袖を思わせる形状が名前の由来。
sen.e: The origin of the name is the shape which is associated with a sleeve of kimono.

sen.j: 清水寺成就院書院縁先にあるものが有名。

sen.j: 縁がでこぼこし、凹凸が激しい石に水穴をあけたもの。

sen.j: あんこう型

sen.j: 見立てもの手水鉢
sen.e: Mitatemono chozubachi (literally re-used-object water basins)
Mitatemono chozubachi (literally re-used-object water basins)
Mitatemono chozubachi (literally re-used-object water basins)

sen.j: 打ち捨てられた、燈籠や塔の部分を利用して作った手水鉢で、古びた風合いが「わび・さび」を感じさせるものになっている。
sen.e: It is a chozubachi made of a part of the deserted stone lantern or pagoda, and its old texture evokes the feelings of 'wabi and sabi.'
It is a chozubachi made of a part of the deserted stone lantern or pagoda, and its old texture evokes the feelings of 'wabi and sabi.'
It is a chozubachi made of a part of the deserted stone lantern or pagoda, and its old texture evokes the feelings of 'wabi and sabi.'

sen.j: 袈裟型
sen.e: The kesa (surplice) type
The kesa (surplice) type
The kesa (surplice) type

sen.j: 石造宝塔の塔身を利用して作られるもので回りに袈裟状の格子模様が入る。
sen.e: This is made from the stone pagoda and its edge has surplice-shaped lattice pattern.
This is made from the stone pagoda and its edge has a surplice-shaped lattice pattern.
This is made from the stone pagoda and its edge has a surplice-shaped lattice pattern.

sen.j: 東本願寺渉成園縮景亭にあるものは鎌倉時代の宝塔の塔身を使用している。
sen.e: The one in the Shukkei-tei of the Shosei-en Garden in the Higashi Hongan-ji Temple was made out of the stone pagoda in the Kamakura period.

sen.e: The foundation of stone lantern is used for this type, and it is considered that the one with 'kaeribana (lotus petal design carved around the lower base of a lantern)' is valuable.

sen.e: The top story called umbrella of the multi-storied pagoda is laid on its side and the part of eave is carved in the shape of basin; this is unusual type.

sen.j: 石灯篭や多層塔などの笠の部分を逆さにして反りの美しさを見立てた手水鉢
sen.e: The umbrella part of a stone lantern or a multi-storied pagoda is put upside down, and its beautiful curve is used for the chozubachi.

sen.j: 創作手水鉢
sen.e: Creative chozubachi
Creative chozubachi
Creative chozubachi

sen.j: 江戸時代になりと露地に手水鉢が不可欠のものと見なされるようになり、天然自然のものを利用したものから、露地の手水鉢の用途のためにデザインされ作られたものが登場するようになった。
sen.e: In the Edo period, chozubachi came to be considered essential in roji, and many chozubachi came into existence such as the ones made of natural materials and the ones designed especially for the chozubachi at roji.

During the Edo period, chozubachi came to be considered essential in roji, and many chozubachi came into existence such as those made of natural materials and those designed especially for the chozubachi at roji.

sen.j: 現在「手水鉢」といわれているものの多くがこの区分に入るもので「名園」「名庭」の「名品」の模倣が多く出回っている。
sen.e: Today most of the washbasins called 'chozubachi' belong to this category, and a lot of imitations of 'masterpieces' in the 'famous gardens' are appearing on the market.
